children.subject: It's not too late to apply for summer 2020 roles. Last year I started applying in late February and got an offer in either March or April (I don't quite remember). Lots of other people have similar stories.
As an aside, I definitely don't think it's too late to land an internship. Spring semester just began, I wouldn't give up until end of semester.
++ i've gotten an internship offer the week after school ended. lots of companies (maybe not the big 5ish) recruit until may.
^^^^ I believe Apple and Amazon are still recruiting.
And Microsoft, if you have a referral on you.
Wait, really? I might know someone who could refer me but I didn't bother asking them because I thought Microsoft isn't recruiting anymore.
Thanks! This helps me keep my hopes alive. How do I get my foot in the door without a referral? All I need is a chance to interview.
I got my internship offer on the last day of dead week. You should keep looking; you can withdraw from summer classes pretty late.

history.content: This is my personal opinion - for UC Berkeley graduates, internship experience is not required for a full-time job offer, or full-time job offers at "top" companies. Check interview criteria for the specific job listing and prepare based on that (technical + behavioral skills). Class and personal projects can make up for internship experience, especially if completed with others in groups (collaboration skills). A high GPA helps as well.

This is my personal opinion - if you are a UC Berkeley student, internship experience is not required for a full-time job offer, or full-time job offers at "top" companies. Check interview criteria for the specific job listing and prepare based on that (technical + behavioral skills). Class and personal projects can make up for internship experience, especially if completed with others in groups (collaboration skills). A high GPA helps as well.

Hi,

Am a junior EECS major who did not manage to score an internship for this summer. Long story short, I took last semester off and wasn’t in a position to recruit for internships since, well, am an international student and there was no way I’d be able to undergo the internship recruitment process since I was not physically present to do so. What this means is that I’ll have to take summer classes since it’s currently too late to apply for summer 2020 roles. So now, is it possible to get a full time offer with zero internship experience?

Tl;dr? Will I be at a huge disadvantage when trying to get a full-time job offer without any internships on my resume? ( super-depressed into oblivion)
history.subject: Graduate with zero internships. What next?
